operations.notes: This YANG module defines a data model for the configuration\nof IEEE 1588-2008 clocks, and also for retrieval of the state\ndata of IEEE 1588-2008 clocks.

List of one or more PTP datasets in the device, one for
each domain (see IEEE 1588-2008 subclause 6.3).
Each PTP dataset represents a distinct instance of
PTP implementation in the device (i.e. distinct
Ordinary Clock or Boundary Clock).

parameters.name: instance-number
parameters.description: The instance number of the current PTP instance

ietf-ptp-dataset:clock-class.description: The clockClass denotes the traceability of the time\nor frequency distributed by the clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:clock-accuracy.description: The clockAccuracy indicates the expected accuracy\nof the clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:offset-scaled-log-varia.description:
The offsetScaledLogVariance provides an
estimate of the variations of the clock
from a linear timescale when it is not synchronized
to another clock using the protocol.

clock-class.description: The clockClass denotes the traceability of the time\nor frequency distributed by the clock.

clock-accuracy.description: The clockAccuracy indicates the expected accuracy\nof the clock.

offset-scaled-log-variance.description:
The offsetScaledLogVariance provides an
estimate of the variations of the clock
from a linear timescale when it is not synchronized
to another clock using the protocol.

ietf-ptp-dataset:clock-quality.description: The clockQuality of the local clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:two-step-flag.description: When set, the clock is a two-step clock; otherwise,\nthe clock is a one-step clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:clock-identity.description: The clockIdentity of the local clock

ietf-ptp-dataset:number-ports.description: The number of PTP ports on the device.

ietf-ptp-dataset:clock-quality.description: The clockQuality of the local clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:priority1.description: The priority1 attribute of the local clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:priority2.description: The priority2 attribute of the local clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:domain-number.description: The domain number of the current syntonization\ndomain.

ietf-ptp-dataset:slave-only.description: When set, the clock is a slave-only clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:onf-ptp-dataset:designa.description: A PTP Clock needs to be enabled by management.

two-step-flag.description: When set, the clock is a two-step clock; otherwise,\nthe clock is a one-step clock.

clock-identity.description: The clockIdentity of the local clock

number-ports.description: The number of PTP ports on the device.

priority1.description: The priority1 attribute of the local clock.

priority2.description: The priority2 attribute of the local clock.

domain-number.description: The domain number of the current syntonization\ndomain.

slave-only.description: When set, the clock is a slave-only clock.

designated-enabled.description: A PTP Clock needs to be enabled by management.

ietf-ptp-dataset:default-ds.description: The default data set of the clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:steps-removed.description: The number of communication paths traversed\nbetween the local clock and the grandmaster clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:offset-from-master.description: The current value of the time difference between\na master and a slave clock as computed by the slave.

ietf-ptp-dataset:mean-path-delay.description: The current value of the mean propagation time between\na master and a slave clock as computed by the slave.

steps-removed.description: The number of communication paths traversed\nbetween the local clock and the grandmaster clock.

offset-from-master.description: The current value of the time difference between\na master and a slave clock as computed by the slave.

mean-path-delay.description: The current value of the mean propagation time between\na master and a slave clock as computed by the slave.

ietf-ptp-dataset:current-ds.description: The current data set of the clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:parent-port-identity.description: The portIdentity of the port on the master

ietf-ptp-dataset:clock-class.description: The clockClass denotes the traceability of the time\nor frequency distributed by the clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:clock-accuracy.description: The clockAccuracy indicates the expected accuracy\nof the clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:offset-scaled-log-varia.description:
The offsetScaledLogVariance provides an
estimate of the variations of the clock
from a linear timescale when it is not synchronized
to another clock using the protocol.

clock-class.description: The clockClass denotes the traceability of the time\nor frequency distributed by the clock.

clock-accuracy.description: The clockAccuracy indicates the expected accuracy\nof the clock.

offset-scaled-log-variance.description:
The offsetScaledLogVariance provides an
estimate of the variations of the clock
from a linear timescale when it is not synchronized
to another clock using the protocol.

ietf-ptp-dataset:grandmaster-clock-quali.description: The clockQuality of the grandmaster clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:parent-port-identity.description: The portIdentity of the port on the master

ietf-ptp-dataset:parent-stats.description:
When set, the values of
observedParentOffsetScaledLogVariance and
observedParentClockPhaseChangeRate of parentDS
have been measured and are valid.

ietf-ptp-dataset:observed-parent-offset-.description: An estimate of the parent clock's PTP variance\nas observed by the slave clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:observed-parent-clock-p.description: An estimate of the parent clock's phase change rate\nas observed by the slave clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:grandmaster-identity.description: The clockIdentity attribute of the grandmaster clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:grandmaster-clock-quali.description: The clockQuality of the grandmaster clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:grandmaster-priority1.description: The priority1 attribute of the grandmaster clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:grandmaster-priority2.description: The priority2 attribute of the grandmaster clock.

parent-stats.description:
When set, the values of
observedParentOffsetScaledLogVariance and
observedParentClockPhaseChangeRate of parentDS
have been measured and are valid.

observed-parent-offset-scaled-log-varian.description: An estimate of the parent clock's PTP variance\nas observed by the slave clock.

observed-parent-clock-phase-change-rate.description: An estimate of the parent clock's phase change rate\nas observed by the slave clock.

grandmaster-identity.description: The clockIdentity attribute of the grandmaster clock.

grandmaster-priority1.description: The priority1 attribute of the grandmaster clock.

grandmaster-priority2.description: The priority2 attribute of the grandmaster clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:parent-ds.description: The parent data set of the clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:current-utc-offset-vali.description: When set, the current UTC offset is valid.

ietf-ptp-dataset:current-utc-offset.description: The offset between TAI and UTC when the epoch of the\nPTP system is the PTP epoch, i.e., when ptp-timescale\nis TRUE; otherwise, the value has no meaning.

ietf-ptp-dataset:leap59.description: When set, the last minute of the current UTC day\ncontains 59 seconds.

ietf-ptp-dataset:leap61.description: When set, the last minute of the current UTC day\ncontains 61 seconds.

ietf-ptp-dataset:time-traceable.description: When set, the timescale and the currentUtcOffset are\n   traceable to a primary reference.

ietf-ptp-dataset:frequency-traceable.description: When set, the frequency determining the timescale\nis traceable to a primary reference.

ietf-ptp-dataset:ptp-timescale.description: When set, the clock timescale of the grandmaster\n    clock is PTP; otherwise, the timescale is ARB\n   (arbitrary).

ietf-ptp-dataset:time-source.description: The source of time used by the grandmaster clock.

current-utc-offset-valid.description: When set, the current UTC offset is valid.

current-utc-offset.description: The offset between TAI and UTC when the epoch of the\nPTP system is the PTP epoch, i.e., when ptp-timescale\nis TRUE; otherwise, the value has no meaning.

leap59.description: When set, the last minute of the current UTC day\ncontains 59 seconds.

leap61.description: When set, the last minute of the current UTC day\ncontains 61 seconds.

time-traceable.description: When set, the timescale and the currentUtcOffset are\n   traceable to a primary reference.

frequency-traceable.description: When set, the frequency determining the timescale\nis traceable to a primary reference.

ptp-timescale.description: When set, the clock timescale of the grandmaster\n    clock is PTP; otherwise, the timescale is ARB\n   (arbitrary).

time-source.description: The source of time used by the grandmaster clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:time-properties-ds.description: The timeProperties data set of the clock.

ietf-ptp-dataset:port-identity.description: The portIdentity attribute of the local port.

ietf-ptp-dataset:port-number.description: Refers to the portNumber memer of\nportDS.portIdentity.

ietf-ptp-dataset:port-identity.description: The portIdentity attribute of the local port.

ietf-ptp-dataset:port-state.description: Current state associated with the port.

ietf-ptp-dataset:log-min-delay-req-inter.description: The base-two logarithm of the minDelayReqInterval\n(the minimum permitted mean time interval between\nsuccessive Delay_Req messages).

ietf-ptp-dataset:peer-mean-path-delay.description: An estimate of the current one-way propagation delay\non the link when the delayMechanism is P2P; otherwise,\nit is zero.

ietf-ptp-dataset:log-announce-interval.description: The base-two logarithm of the mean\nannounceInterval (mean time interval between\nsuccessive Announce messages).

ietf-ptp-dataset:announce-receipt-timeou.description:
The number of announceInterval that have to pass
without receipt of an Announce message before the
occurrence of the event ANNOUNCE_RECEIPT_TIMEOUT_
EXPIRES.

ietf-ptp-dataset:log-sync-interval.description:
The base-two logarithm of the mean SyncInterval
for multicast messages.  The rates for unicast
transmissions are negotiated separately on a per port
basis and are not constrained by this attribute.

ietf-ptp-dataset:delay-mechanism.description: The propagation delay measuring option used by the\nport in computing meanPathDelay.

ietf-ptp-dataset:log-min-pdelay-req-inte.description: The base-two logarithm of the\nminPdelayReqInterval (minimum permitted mean time\ninterval between successive Pdelay_Req messages).

ietf-ptp-dataset:version-number.description: The PTP version in use on the port.

ietf-ptp-dataset:onf-ptp-dataset:master-.description: Indicates that port can only be a master.

ietf-ptp-dataset:onf-ptp-dataset:local-p.description: Local priority as used for alternate BMCA

ietf-ptp-dataset:onf-ptp-dataset:designa.description: A PTP Port needs to be enabled by management.

ietf-ptp-dataset:onf-ptp-dataset:delay-a.description: As per PTP	Known path asymmetry in ns.

ietf-ptp-dataset:onf-ptp-dataset:logical.description: A reference to a LTP of layer-protocol-name 'ETY' or 'MWPS', which is used\nto discover the PTP topology.

port-number.description: Refers to the portNumber memer of\nportDS.portIdentity.

port-state.description: Current state associated with the port.

log-min-delay-req-interval.description: The base-two logarithm of the minDelayReqInterval\n(the minimum permitted mean time interval between\nsuccessive Delay_Req messages).

peer-mean-path-delay.description: An estimate of the current one-way propagation delay\non the link when the delayMechanism is P2P; otherwise,\nit is zero.

log-announce-interval.description: The base-two logarithm of the mean\nannounceInterval (mean time interval between\nsuccessive Announce messages).

announce-receipt-timeout.description:
The number of announceInterval that have to pass
without receipt of an Announce message before the
occurrence of the event ANNOUNCE_RECEIPT_TIMEOUT_
EXPIRES.

log-sync-interval.description:
The base-two logarithm of the mean SyncInterval
for multicast messages.  The rates for unicast
transmissions are negotiated separately on a per port
basis and are not constrained by this attribute.

delay-mechanism.description: The propagation delay measuring option used by the\nport in computing meanPathDelay.

log-min-pdelay-req-interval.description: The base-two logarithm of the\nminPdelayReqInterval (minimum permitted mean time\ninterval between successive Pdelay_Req messages).

version-number.description: The PTP version in use on the port.

master-only.description: Indicates that port can only be a master.

local-priority.description: Local priority as used for alternate BMCA

designated-enabled.description: A PTP Port needs to be enabled by management.

delay-asymmetry.description: As per PTP	Known path asymmetry in ns.

logical-termination-point.description: A reference to a LTP of layer-protocol-name 'ETY' or 'MWPS', which is used\nto discover the PTP topology.
